alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 5:39AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM MDT/830 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Kansas, including the following counties, Greeley, Wallace and Wichita. * WHEN...Until 730 AM MDT /830 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems and waterways * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 433 AM MDT /533 AM CDT/, Storms had exited the area a few hours ago. With 2 to 4 inches of rain fallen, flood prone areas and some backroads may still be flooded. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Greeley, South Central Wallace and Northwestern Wichita Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
